page.title: 10TRANSPORT ON WHALSAY-BUSES
page.content:
{BUSES
There are four buses on Whalsay 3 big 29 seater buses and 1 20 seater bus. Two of the buses drive children to and from the school every week. The buses used to belong to Tammy Arthur but due to ill health and the high cost of replacement buses the running of them was taken over by the Council in 1979. The buses take children under five to the playschool on Monday,Wednesday and Thursday. Buses also run workers to the Fish Factory at 7.00 am and home at 5.00pm. They also do{special runs}to take {Senior Citizens}and{S.W.R.I.}members to and from their meetings held in the Symbister Public Hall. On other occasions a bus may go to the Shetland Mainland with a party on an outing.
